channel.title: Making Algorithm/ Defining 2D Shapes without GUI
channel.description: This is partly connected to my simulation topic, but kind different. I need help defining primarily Rectangles and Line segments. I am not using Gui for this either, rather just numbers and charts in Excel. If anyone with 2D Shape experience could help that would be awesome. Partly for my simulation, partly for just expanding my knowledge. (Willing to TV Respected and trustful members.) For the algorithm part, i need a method to count how many times the molecule pass through the membrane and it counts and adds up until the server tick grabs it and resets. My java knowledge is not this extensive so I do need help. I am currently learning IO.

item.title: Making Algorithm/ Defining 2D Shapes without GUI
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

I suppose, but I honestly don’t ha e experience with shapes in Java which is why I am requesting more specific help.

Read full topic

item.title: Making Algorithm/ Defining 2D Shapes without GUI
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Couldn’t you just have a Molecule object with a Location, and whenever an update is called it sees if the molecule is outside the bounds of the circle?

public class Molecule {
    private Location location;

    // getters and setters
}

Read full topic
item.source: Making Algorithm/ Defining 2D Shapes without GUI
